السلام عليكم, محتاج منك بس بعض المعلومات, وعلى أساسها نقيم الوضع ونحدد أولويات العمل على كل جزء من الموقع على حدا.
انا هكتبهم فى الكومينت التالى علشان موضوع دمج العربي والإنجليزي فى الفيسبوك بيخرف :)

1- what type of websites are we talking about? (news-media-social-reports-shopping-etc)
2- visits per day?
3- are the DB operations mostly reads or writes?
4- how many servers for the web/db?
5- Connection utilization between the DB & web instances. (I've seen times when the problem was that the 100MB connection was saturated, and upgrading to a 1 Gbit connection has solved certain problems).
6- have you evaluated the executed SQL queries using tools like "SQL Server Tuning Advisor"?
7- snapshot of the average resources allocation of each server (web-db) covering CPU average %, Ram,network.

you don't have to reveal all these info on public :), if you prefer we may have a phone call and let's discuss it over there.
if it's fine to report these points here, kindly let me know your feedback, and ISA we gonna have a discussion to reach the perfect solution for your scenario :)
Finally: Thank you for calling "Egyptian Geeks" support team :D

first of all you must understand that the concept of CDN is depend on site has multi geographical visitors. so I don't know who you target. as if you building custom cdn is quite expensive. and is most used for videos hosting site. but if is news or just html data and you have china in your concern as visitors so then you need build distribution caching server in China.

and if what you looking is hardware availability to reduce cpu loads etc ... in this case you need load balancer either with hardware or/and software 

and if you looking for network solution high availability like 100% in this case is more expensive and still need to be managed by network designer for each datacenter you gonna to host at.

your question is really very open and I believe is not  asp.net question or any developing related question. this what network engineer and sys admin do. if you're not a sys admin you better work with someone then who can advise you more and give you tailored solution on demand of what you required

CDNs have benefits beyond geo distributed visitors. You still offload the work of serving files to different machine. Browser can request only 6 files simultaneously from a single point. Add the traffic associated with the CDN file.. You get the picture

if you want to reduce load or making high availability you can make load balancer or many other solutions. but when it comes to cdn so is same concept but with multi location all over the world which is more expensive than single location hosting
